content.label: Excellent game in every respect and very challenging!  Buy it!
Fantastic game, excellent app. I play exclusively solo and the challenges provide hours of fun!

Verified that family sharing works, and we also play with friends who bought the game with their own money. We had one terminal glitch and had to abandon a game but otherwise it‚Äôs been pretty flawless over many games. 

There is a learning curve. I mostly lose, but still have fun. You can play with people you know or people you don‚Äôt know or by yourself (against the computer).

The pacing is so perfect. You play a hand for five minutes and then walk away while waiting for others to play. My games typically last about a week and provide little moments of fun several times a day when it‚Äôs my turn to play. 

I bought an expansion pack and it‚Äôs fun. Unfortunately expansion packs don‚Äôt work with family sharing. 

Devices tested include iPhone 11 Pro, iPhone 10, and iPad Pro 2018. 

Play the tutorial and read the rules - you‚Äôll have less frustration that way.
I keep coming back to 5is game.  I really like how they did the expansions to make it more re-playable.

title.label: Love it but fix the crashing!

content.label: I had this game for a few years and love it.  So much so that I got the expansion and even ordered the original board game!  I recently redownloaded it to my phone and can‚Äôt get it to stop crashing.  Have to literally load it TWENTY times or more to get it to actually run without crashing.  Then sometimes it will crash after you‚Äôve been playing for thirty minutes and won‚Äôt let you back in again without crashing.  Fix the crashes so I can give you five stars!
Fantastic UI, honestly better than playing in person. The online games have a glitch maybe 1 out of 100 games which is a great rate
Best game ever developed.  Been playing thousands of hours
Nothing not to like about this one.

title.label: Latest update made the game less fun to play

content.label:
EDIT: Podcasts work again after latest update. Most excellent. 

I used to be able to listen to podcasts while playing, but now this game kills all audio playing from other apps. And the rendering is now causing crashing. I can tell it speeds up frame rate during animations which looks pretty when it works, but if you play with the hard AI the CPU still kills the frame rate so it is kind of pointless. But as it is a turn based game, who cares about frame rate?  Wish I could downgrade.

title.label: Loved this game until it kept crashing this week

content.label: I have been playing and raving about this game to family and friends for a year, thus past week it kept crashing on my iPad even if I have the latest updates. Contacted customer support through the app and reached out to their Facebook but received no answer. Please help me play again!
Since the last update it takes FOREVER against the AI.  You also can‚Äôt pick up a saved game anymore.  Super annoying!
I really like games that have a start and end. You can learn how to play and do better next time. Worth the money if you are into deep strategy games. I still haven‚Äôt mastered the medium challenge

The app updated on 10/5. Now it doesn‚Äôt work. When I tell it to load a game, it acts like it, the bounces out of the app.
When I double click to see the apps that are up, it shows up. 
But when I select it, it repeats the loading process. 
Running on an iPhone 6 iOS 12.4.8
In the tutorial when I get to the part about ‚Äútap opponents strength rating‚Äù and the... Tactics Help box opens, the app freezes no matter how many times I restart the level.  Please help.
Good overall, but for the past couple months the game sometimes does not send a notification or badge
I‚Äôve played a few games and am amazed at the perfection. The tutorial by itself is worth at least half the cost for new players like me.

This is a decent port of the tabletop game.
It loses a lot of points for forcing users to make an account and literally locking the expansion we paid for in the online game account. Bad bad bad.

The game just crashed twice on me, iphone 6s. I swear I don‚Äôt know why I buy boardgame apps anymore.

An outstanding app. UI is user friendly, with a valued ‚Äòundo‚Äô option. Game is great; it has a learning curve, but AI has multiple levels facilitating the learning. Expansion adds diversity and is worth the buy.

title.label: Best Card-driven Civilization digitalized board game

content.label:
I‚Äôm a big board & card game enthusiast with a fairly large collection (compared w/ normal folks) and this digitalized version might even be better than its original 2nd Edition tabletop version. This is easily my favorite Civilization-themed board game and I love playing it online with my real-life gamer friends. 

This digital version allows for the near perfect info of tracking all the game decks and each opponents‚Äô civilization, all at your very fingertips. Now, the new expansion allows for more variety and mix of cards to keep the game fresh with every new session. 

I wholeheartedly recommend this Civ based game as it has some learning curve but its really worth the ascent.

My friends and I have tried many  online board game apps, this one is by far the best!  The UI is intuitive, you actually receive notifications when it‚Äôs your turn!  They streamlines the colony bidding to make asynchronous play smoother!  Just hands down all around fantastic.  We actually prefer this version to playing in real life which honestly is not something I think I can say about most board game adaptations.  Oh and the same itself if fantastic which helps a lot too!
This is a wonderful digital translation if the original tabletop game. Do the entire tutorial, its totally worth the time.

The game itself is an awesome game, but takes a super long time to learn and play. This app makes it MUCH easier to play quick games against actually competent AI. The challenges are fun and engaging, and the app is super well designed. It‚Äôs the first board game app I‚Äôve had that has an undo button, which I feel like should be a requirement for all board game apps.

Edited - The developers got back to me and suggested that my iPad might be older and if I click the option for reduced graphics it might help. It fixed the issue completely and I can‚Äôt even tell a difference. 

I love this game. It is super fun and addictive. It would be 5 stars except for when I try to play the challenges the app keeps crashing. You can restart it and it doesn‚Äôt lose your spot, but it will only crash again and again. Usually once it starts it will keep happening over and over and it takes a long time to be able to finish the game. What is weird is it lets you play more than half the game before it crashes the first time.
It‚Äôs a fantastic game and works really well on iOS. However, the app has all kinds of problems and any frequent player has memorized the ‚ÄúConnection to Server Failed‚Äù screen by now.
Excellent civ builder game!
I might have ever spent.

Never played the table top version but this digital adaptation is so well done. From an impressive tutorial to an incredible interface they did an amazing job.  The game is complex, but they did so well at streamlining the game. There is an undo button (thanks) and everything is done in a way to assist you as you play. Have not tried asynchronous gameplay yet but looking forward to it.
Always lots to try and discover. Super adaptation to iPhone.
I lose all the time

If there is one thing I have to say about this game, it needs difficulties. And when I say that, I mean the training needs to be training, easy needs to be easy and so on.
There needs to be a better sense of progress. Not punishment/frustration. Tone it down.

I have seen the reviews here and I believe there need to be more critical/helpful reviews. This game is interesting but feels ‚Äúhopeless‚Äù at the same time. It really is no fun to play a game where the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù AI is already hard. Why play further then? It‚Äôs a card game, not an IQ test. And the card game is way too complicated compared to others.

I have played plenty of civilization/strategy games throughout my life - Civilization, Age of Empires, Armello and so on - and never have I faced a more discouraging game than this. I have hardly beaten the easy AI, which is not a good thing. I usually don‚Äôt even know how I won, considering the AI spam the bonus points at the end. That should be the medium or hard AI. But when it‚Äôs easy alone that shows you up, why even bother trying anymore? It really is discouraging. And how can the hard AI be any harder if easy knows the game so well?

I have tried this game at least a dozen times and don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm learning anything. 7 Wonders is why I even found this game and that card game is way more balanced/easy. And when I lose at that, I don‚Äôt feel nearly as defeated. It‚Äôs a good game for all.

It‚Äôs as several reviews have said for me; I feel like I am catching up with the AI only to have the game end. It‚Äôs ends too soon. There is a growing sense of frustration that defeats you right off with this. And playing a training AI is not an answer. That‚Äôs just dull. You just cut off its one hand/move. Brutal. Again, you don‚Äôt really learn anything, you just try to cheap win.
It‚Äôs way too hard to start a new game with specific people. Would be much better if we could just rematch after a completed game. An auto-rematch option would be even better!

title.label: Make custom games more custom please!

content.label:
Absolutely love the digital version of this game! My only suggestion is if you could give us a little bit more freedom in the custom custom game settings. I want the option to make my games longer, and do wacky stuff with the settings kind of like you have the challenge modes set up. Users love more freedom! 

Other then that, this is everything I would hope a ‚ÄúThrough the Ages,‚Äù digital version would be! Excellent work and I look forward to see what else the team can dream up for the future of this magnificent board game.

I reviewed this better before I spent a lot of time with it. Now I hate this game and here's why. First off, NO GAME I've ever played has a worse model of "winners keep winning, losers keep losing" than this game. About 75% of the events reward the strongest player and penalize the weakest player, not to mention direct actions like wars and raids. 

If you EVER fall behind on anything (and at least one player is weakest by definition), EVERY OTHER PLAYER attacks you constantly because it's free benefits for them. You become their resource and that's the end for you. 

If you fall behind on production, you get stuck in an impossible situation where you need x of A to make B to make C, which takes several turns while the other player is chugging along. The gap just widens over time. 

And I haven't even mentioned how the EASY AI is virtually unbeatable. You have to be an absolute pro to beat the medium AI, and most of the SP challenges use medium AI or harder. I've put in tons of hours since this game came out, including referencing Board Game Geeks.com for tips; it has been 90% frustration, and I'm a gaming vet.
Amazing port of the game. The user interface is incredibly polished. I have almost 100 hours into this game.
I bought this game to teach me how to play the board game, so I can teach my friends. I am so happy I did. There are many nuances and details I may have missed. Highly recommended.
Just finished my first match, and I have no words to describe it! That's just an amazing strategy game, I'll come back later to write a more detailed review.

title.label: Favorite Game in a Long Time

content.label: Amazing game. Some minor bugs from time to time, but nothing major. Super fun to play and great online multiplayer experience.

title.label: Best board game and board game app

content.label: Tried a lot of Euros in real life and in the App Store and this one is the best.
Excellent presentation and challenging AI.

Note: Possible bug? Recently got latest update plus expansion. Several times, in Medium Level Mixed Cards challenge against two computer AI, the International Agreement cars will not allow me to choose cards when I choose the Skip Politics option, even when my hand is empty. Very frustrating :(

Actual Review:
An obvious labor love. Can be overwhelming to absolute newbs but then the tutorial is funny and informative. Lots of challenges to keep on and offline gamers busy. NOT a Civilization clone, but fans of Sid Meier‚Äôs Civ are likely to dig this. I really appreciated the visuals, with upgraded buildings and acquired colonies showing up on the map and really giving you a feel for how far you‚Äôve come. The only bug I‚Äôve run into is the one listed above, as of September 2019. Worth the 10 bucks.
Gre

title.label: One of my favorite board games

content.label:
I was thrilled to find there is an app for this game. The price tag made me hesitate for a moment, but I could not ask for anything better. There is a more streamlined/app friendly version of the rules, but I chose to stick with the tabletop rules, and it is exactly like the game. If, such as is my case, you don't know anybody with the patience for an hours-long game, then this is for you. If you enjoy Through The Ages, then it is definitely worth it!

EXPANSION UPDATE: As soon as I discovered there was an expansion released, I bought it immediately. I was very pleased with the new dimensions added by the leaders and wonders, and they make you rethink a go-to strategy, or even take a course you normally would not have taken with just the base cards. I switched to using the digital rules and they are very minor changes but make online games a breeze. I am looking forward to the physical release of the expansion!

title.label: Great version of a great game

content.label: My wife and I have played the board game version of this game and love it, but there is a lot to keep track of with bonuses and all the different types of resources.  Also, we have two little kids who would love nothing more than to chow down on the bricks.  This app does a wonderful job keeping everything straight, removes setup/cleanup time, and takes away the choking hazard!  Five stars.  And the expansion is worth it.

If you play/have the board game this is an absolute must buy. The interface is as elegant as any I‚Äôve seen. It is true to the tabletop game. And probably best of all, the AI is challenging but fair. Admittedly I already know the game, but I also thought the tutorial was complete and excellent as well. This should be the standard for any board game going digital.

title.label: Great game, but new expansion crashes...

content.label: This is hands down one of my favorite board games. The new expansion seems pretty cool, but I can't complete a game, it keeps crashing on me. Please fix it! Thanks!

IMHO, it is better than the board game. I even like it better than Sid Meier‚Äôs Civilization. Perfect execution, wonderful AI and the most fun tutorial for a board game ever. Expect a learning curve but it is worth it.

And please just ignore the negative reviews, especially the one from someone who calls himself a ‚Äúgaming vet‚Äù but who can‚Äôt beat the game on easy. That review says more about the writer the game. The game is challenging but if you pay attention to what is going on then you will be beating the AI on hard pretty quickly, and you will love doing so.
The high watermark for digital boardgames. Smooths out all of the bookkeeping and gives you all the information you could possibly ask for.

title.label: Fantastic implementation of a great board game

content.label: I‚Äôve owned both physical versions of this game and it was always a bit too fussy for me. This version massively simplifies the bookkeeping and is very informative; it warns you when you‚Äôre about to do something silly and even reminds you when a card you placed in the event deck must be the next one to appear. The tutorial explains the game quickly and humorously. Highest recommendation!

title.label: Repeated crash. Can‚Äôt play at all

content.label: I have an ipad air and this game repeatedly crash out.
I‚Äôm a huge fan of the game. I think you guys should be charging more for the expansion! You deserve it.
